newsitem.title: COTE D'IVOIRE: Three student leaders jailed in Ivory Coast.
newsitem.headline: Three student leaders jailed in Ivory Coast.

text.p: A court in Ivory Coast sentenced three student leaders to two years in prison and fined them 300,000 CFA francs ($572) each on Tuesday after a trial on public order charges. A fourth student was acquitted and discharged.
The jailed students -- Charles Ble Goude, Damana Adio and Sylvanus Gore as well as their discharged colleague, Souleymane Kamagate -- have been in detention since December 19.
Colleagues said they were arrested after responding to an invitation by Security Minister Dibona Kone to a meeting to discuss a clash the previous day between police and students.
All four, who are leaders of a banned students organisation, pleaded not guilty to charges of inciting violence and actions against public order.
